items.summary: Godard, 73, was murdered on October 7, 2023, alongside his wife in Kibbutz Be'eri by Islamic Jihad, the Israeli army confirmed Thursday. Three deceased hostages remain in Gaza

items.title: 'I figured there was an 18% chance she'd say yes. Sure enough, she said no'
items.summary: This week at Ben-Gurion Airport: A couple who grew up in the same town and reconnected during the pandemic, and a dad who takes himself on a four-day reset in Greece

items.title: Watch: Blue Origin rocket successfully lands booster for first time
items.summary: Jeff Bezos' space company saw its first successful return landing of a reusable booster - a feat that SpaceX pioneered.

items.title: After the Sde Teiman abuse affair, it's open season on Israeli judges, generals and journalists
items.summary: What was done to former military advocate general Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi by Netanyahu's poison machine now serves as a warning to every ranking figure in the country's security and legal establishment: anyone who dares to take a stand against the prime minister's interests can expect consequences

items.title: The Israeli government's war on Army Radio is a message to the pro-Netanyahu base
items.summary: More than he wants to shutter Army Radio, Defense Minister Katz wants to show his and his prime minister's supporters that, once again, their bold moves were thwarted by the 'left-wing' justices ■ What can we learn about Israel's transition to an illiberal democracy from the fact we're astonished ev

items.title: Trump envoy Witkoff reportedly planning meeting with top Hamas official on Gaza cease-fire
The Jewish people's parliament has a new force at the table: the evangelical right
items.summary: For the first time in the history of the Zionist movement, a faction aligned with hard-right Christians has gained a foothold in the World Zionist Congress. It's all thanks to Israel's own messianic Minister Bezalel Smotrich

items.title: With a pardon, Trump is trying to lure Netanyahu into signing a peace deal with Palestinians
items.summary: Trump knows that the only person who can sell Netanyahu's supporters on a diplomatic process in the spirit of a two-state solution with the Palestinians is Netanyahu himself. He just needs to form a government without the extreme right

items.title: It's not a Palestinian writer's job to comfort Israeli liberals
Israel's violent Jewish settlers are neither marginal nor a handful
Israeli soldiers accused of abusing Palestinian detainee ask court to drop charges
items.summary: Chief military prosecutor calls for new military advocate general to delve into the case as quickly as possible

items.title: Head of Israel Police's serious crimes unit investigated for breach of trust, abuse of authority
items.summary: According to police sources familiar with the case, Chief Superintendent Meni Benjamin, head of the Lahav 433 anti-corruption and serious crime unit, is suspected of intervening in an investigation and making decisions to benefit a person close to him

items.title: Israel Police make five arrests after two separate homicides in Tel Aviv and Kfar Qasem
items.summary: An African migrant was found dead in South Tel Aviv's Kiryat Shalom, showing signs of violence ■ Police detain four brothers of Kafr Qasem woman who dies after she was shot in her car and crashed into a wall

items.title: Revised U.S. Gaza proposal cites path to Palestinian statehood for first time as Trump rallies international support for peace plan
items.summary: In a notable shift, the U.S. has revised its UN Security Council resolution, the third draft submitted to date, to include mention of a pathway to Palestinian statehood. The resolution reflects ongoing efforts to secure international consensus for Trump's peace initiatives in Gaza

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
This week, Israel would have made Jewish supremacist Meir Kahane proud
items.summary: This week, the specter of Kahane manifested both in Israel and the West Bank. The far-right rabbi, who once stood as a fringe, solitary lawmaker, could only have dreamed of the legitimacy his followers now wield

items.title: Report: Former top Syrian official, ex-Mossad double agent, charged with torture in Austria
items.summary: A former Syrian official who once worked as a double agent for the Mossad has been charged in Austria with torture during the 2011 Arab Spring protests, The New York Times reported. The official reportedly fled to Europe in 2013 and was ultimately smuggled into Vienna with Israel's help

items.title: Senior Israel Police officer labels Ben-Gvir's participation in raid a publicity stunt
items.summary: Despite the operation's lawful intent, it yielded minimal results, with one unrelated arrest. The incident comes amid escalating violence in Arab Israeli communities, with a significant increase in murders compared to previous years, sparking protests and demands for a state inquiry

items.title: Restored tombstone next to Auschwitz death camp sheds light on vibrant prewar Jewish life
items.summary: Over 8,000 Jews lived in Oswiecim, Poland – adjacent to Auschwitz – on the eve of World War II. A restored grave is a memorial to this proud Jewish Polish community in a country where antisemitism is on the rise

items.title: Four psychiatrists diagnosed him with PTSD. Israel's Defense Ministry says it's just anxiety
items.summary: Israeli soldier Yuval Fisher endured severe psychological trauma during his military service, including surviving a near-fatal rocket explosion. Despite his struggles, he faced denial of mental health support from his military superiors

items.title: Netanyahu says he'll weigh Trump-backed pardon but won't admit guilt in corruption trial
items.summary: In an interview with Australia's Erin Molan, Netanyahu labeled his trial a 'witch hunt' that is hindering his duties as PM. Netanyahu also refuted claims of seeking extended U.S. military aid, emphasizing Israel's self-reliance, and issued his most direct critique of NYC mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani

items.title: Israeli film and TV after October 7: A camera pointed at hell through the smoke
items.summary: The innumerable films and series produced about October 7 are only the beginning. But is there any value to quickly produced works? Where is the line separating documentation from sensational exploitation of the trauma?

items.title: Ending the Gaza war won't halt Israel's legal troubles in The Hague
items.summary: A year after arrest warrants for Netanyahu and former Defense Minister Gallant, and two years into South Africa's ICJ case, the proceedings against Israel remain firmly in place. Trump's sanctions and allegations against Prosecutor Karim Khan have not slowed them, and the arrest of the Military Advo

items.title: Man suspected of weapons procurement for Hamas detained on train in Germany
items.summary: The arrest is one of several suspected Hamas members' in recent weeks, German officials said. The man is alleged to have transported weapons from one suspected Hamas member in the central German state of Hesse to another in Berlin

items.title: Indictment against Palestinians dropped due to Ben-Gvir's decision to delay appointment of key official
items.summary: Israel's far-right national security minister, Itamar Ben-Gvir, has delayed appointing a signatory for confidentiality certificates, halting over 1,250 criminal cases in Israel. Wednesday saw the first dismissal of an indictment against a Palestinian man who had been accused of entering Israel witho

items.title: Dozens of Gazans stranded on plane for over 12 hours after flying from Israel to South Africa
items.summary: Sources at the airport who had been waiting to receive the group said the authorities were refusing to allow the passengers to disembark. The IDF said in response that the departure of Gazans is typically coordinated by Israeli authorities before arriving at another country

items.title: Israel's Herzog pushed for Netanyahu pardon years before becoming president
items.summary: One source told Haaretz that Herzog 'knew he would run for president and wanted to offer the pardon as a kind of goodwill gesture to Likud members, seeking their support.' He kept his stance quiet, partly out of concern over how it might be received by Israel's center-left voters

items.title: Far-right MKs and activists target Israel's campuses. Academia must push back
items.summary: After Deputy Minister Almog Cohen and activists stormed a Ben-Gurion University classroom, one thing is clear: Israeli academia cannot function under threats or political bullying

items.title: Is Netanyahu driving Israelis out the country?
items.summary: That's the conventional wisdom, but the numbers released by the Central Bureau of Statistics this week don't quite show that

items.title: Can Abbas' chosen heir lead the Palestinian Authority without any public support?
items.summary: Mahmoud Abbas' succession plan designating his deputy Hussein al-Sheikh as his successor opens three starkly different paths for the West Bank, from orderly transition to chaos

items.title: 73 athletes, including Paul Pogba, call on UEFA to suspend Israel from European soccer
items.summary: 'No shared venue, stage or arena in international civil society should welcome a regime that commits genocide, apartheid and other crimes against humanity,' the letter said, urging UEFA to ban Israel, following a similar request by the Turkish Football Federation in September

items.title: AG accepts High Court's offer to appoint retired justice to oversee IDF top lawyer case
items.summary: If the stalemate between Justice Minister Yariv Levin, who didn't accept the court's offer, and Attorney General Gali Baharav-Miara continues and no agreement is reached, the High Court is expected to issue a ruling on the matter on Sunday

items.title: Bedouin village to be evacuated despite Israel canceling plans to demolish it
items.summary: The ruling could be used as a precedent to expel other Bedouin villages from lands they have lived on since before the establishment of Israel in 1948, as it was written that turning a blind eye to the village staying on state lands doesn't grant the residents property rights

items.title: Palestinian reports: Settlers torch, vandalize West Bank mosque
items.summary: According to the Wafa news agency, settlers set fire to the entrance of the mosque and sprayed threatening graffiti on its outer walls. The arson comes a day after the IDF acknowledged a sharp rise in cases of Jewish terrorism in the West Bank, but said it stemmed from 'fringe' groups unrepresentati

items.title: Flight prices to east Asia soar as El Al maintains chokehold on Thailand, Japan routes
items.summary: While many foreign airlines have resumed flights to Europe and the U.S., 73.1% of flights to east Asia are operated by Israel's flag carrier, which keeps reporting record quarterly profits

items.title: On four fronts, Trump toils to turn vague plans into a workable Middle East peace
items.summary: The key question now is how far the Trump administration will go - and whether this entire process of regional realignment will ultimately produce a security arrangement between Israel and Syria

items.title: Trump's heavy-handed request to pardon Netanyahu proves: Israel's PM can feel the legal noose tightening
items.summary: As the prime minister's lies and contradictory versions are exposed during his corruption trial, the Israeli fingerprints on Trump's letter requesting a pardon for Netanyahu were unmissable. Instead of defending the justice system, President Herzog responded with the groveling of a junior official,

items.summary: Eli Sharabi's 'Hostage,' which depicts his 491-day captivity in the Gaza Strip, is 'a raw, intimate perspective on one of the most divisive conflicts in modern history,' the magazine wrote

items.title: Autistic teen sexually assaulted by older cellmates after Israeli court ignored his warnings
items.summary: The 14-year-old Jaffa boy - who is being held on security-related charges - told a juvenile court judge that his cellmates beat him and 'forced him to do things,' but she did not order his release or transfer another cell

items.title: There will be no Middle East peace if Trump turns a blind eye to wild settler violence in the West Bank
items.summary: As Israeli settler violence against Palestinians reaches unprecedented levels in the West Bank, the U.S. president refuses to speak out, despite it being a clear obstacle to his grand plans for the region. Instead, he is pursuing a pardon for Netanyahu

Israeli mainstream media must come to its senses and stop normalizing the right's rampage

items.title: Haaretz Cartoon
Freed hostages Aviva and Keith Siegel recount witnessing Hamas sexual abuse and torture
items.summary: Aviva Siegel, who was released in November 2023, told the UN anti-torture committee that the Hamas captors sexually abused the girls she was held with. Keith Siegel said he was 'denied the most basic of human rights. More than once, young terrorists forced me to strip in front of them and shaved my

items.title: Jack Schlossberg, grandson of JFK, to run for U.S. Congress
items.summary: Political commentator and writer Schlossberg, whose work has appeared in The Washington Post, Politico, and Time, joins a crowded field vying for the 12th Congressional District seat as Democrats aim to regain the House in the 2026 midterms

items.title: Palestinian teenager dies in West Bank after month-long coma from IDF tear gas inhalation
items.summary: 13-year-old Issam Jihad Ma'ala began convulsing and suffocating when the IDF started dispersing olive pickers with gas grenades, despite eyewitnesses saying the pickers posed no danger to the soldiers. 'They simply threw gas in every direction,' one eyewitness said

items.title: Trump is showering Netanyahu with gifts. What is he getting in return?
items.summary: Trump's intervention in Netanyahu's trial, breaking all bounds of U.S. involvement in Israeli politics, is a cause for celebration for the prime minister, proving Trump is doing all he can to shield him from the consequences of his own actions

items.title: Ex-Israel Police officer with PTSD dies after self-immolating outside Defense Ministry official's home
items.summary: The officer, 46-year-old Vital Mishayev, had long been recognized within the Defense Ministry's rehabilitation department as struggling with both physical and mental health issues, including post-traumatic stress

items.title: Senior Israel Police officer investigated for breach of trust, abuse of authority
items.summary: According to police sources familiar with the case, the officer, who holds a key and sensitive position overseeing national police units, is suspected of intervening in an investigation and making decisions to benefit a person close to him

items.title: Knesset advances bill granting tax breaks to Israeli West Bank settlements in 'threatened' areas
items.summary: Israeli settlements classified as 'under threat' would receive a 25 percent addition in the total scoring for tax benefits. The bill 'joins the revolution in Judea and Samaria, which effectively consolidates Israeli sovereignty,' settler councils said

items.title: It's not a 'hasbara failure' to seek justice for Palestinian detainees sexually abused by IDF soldiers
items.summary: Rape is not about sexuality, but about power, whether committed by Hamas on October 7 or by Israeli soldiers at the Sde Teiman detention center. In Israel, the furore over a leaked video of sexual torture, and its politicization by Netanyahu, is overshadowing what's really at stake

items.title: Zikim crossing, north of Gaza Strip, opens to allow aid for first time since cease-fire
items.summary: Opening the northern checkpoint will enable larger quantities of aid to enter the Strip. However, the UN claims that Israel still heavily restricts the entry of aid. On Tuesday, UNICEF said it was denied by Israel from bringing syringes needed for a children's vaccination efforts

items.title: House Democrats release Epstein papers saying Trump 'knew about the girls'
items.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump has vehemently and consistently denied knowing about Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking. He has said that he and Epstein, who died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell in 2019, were once friends before having a falling out
